title: How to Make a Krabby Patty

steps.title: Place the chopped onions and celery into a skillet or frying pan.
steps.content: Place the chopped onions and celery into a skillet or frying pan. Sauté in 1 tablespoon (14.8 ml) of oil.

steps.title: Add the thyme.
steps.content: Add the thyme. Reduce the heat and cook gently until the onions wilt, or appear transparent. Avoid browning or burning them.

steps.title: Mix the crabmeat, sauteed onions and celery, breadcrumbs, Dijon mustard, mayonnaise, egg, salt, and pepper in a mixing bowl.
steps.content: Mix the crabmeat, sauteed onions and celery, breadcrumbs, Dijon mustard, mayonnaise , egg, salt, and pepper in a mixing bowl. Mix well until all ingredients are properly combined.

steps.title: Create patties from the mixture.
steps.content: Create patties from the mixture. Make round patty shapes using a mold or your hands. Pat them flat or use the back of a fork.

steps.title: Return to the skillet.
steps.content: Return to the skillet. Heat 3 tablespoons (44.4 ml) of oil. Cook the patties in batches of 2 to 3 at a time. Cook each patty 2 minutes each side, or until the patties are golden brown. Keep adding oil for following batches as needed.

steps.title: Preheat the oven
steps.content: Preheat the oven to 200ºC/400ºF. Add the fried Krabby patties to the oven for a 10 minute bake.

steps.title: Remove and serve.
steps.content: Remove and serve. Serve with a mix 1 cup of mayonnaise and 3 tablespoons (44.4 ml) of ketchup together or serve mayonnaise and ketchup separately.

steps.title: Organize the ground beef into a long layer.
steps.content: Organize the ground beef into a long layer. Make to desired burger thickness.

steps.title: Cut round, patty shapes for the Krabby patties.
steps.content: Cut round, patty shapes for the Krabby patties.

steps.title: Lay the Krabby patties on a grill or frying pan.
steps.content: Lay the Krabby patties on a grill or frying pan. Heat 500ºF for 5-10 minutes on each side for a nice medium to well done patty.

steps.title: Lay the cheese on each of the patties and let melt for 2 minutes.
steps.content: Lay the cheese on each of the patties and let melt for 2 minutes.

steps.title: Take the patties off the grill.
steps.content: Take the patties off the grill. Lay them onto the buns.

steps.title: Add the condiments as listed in the ingredients above.
steps.content: Add the condiments as listed in the ingredients above. For secret Krabby Sauce, mix ketchup and mayonnaise with a very small drop of hot sauce and add to the Krabby patties. [5] X Research source
